body.p:
Henderson Ky
Sept. 1 1865.
Govnr Thomas. E Bramlette.

Your Petitioners would respectfully represent that a Judgment was obtained at the June term of the Henderson Circuit Court in the name of the Commonwealth of Kentucky against D. N Walden late sheriff of Henderson County for Forty -- Dollars for failing to take sufficient security on a capias pro fine Bench warrant against Charles Henessey -- Mr. Walden took the individual Bond of Henessey -- and sufferd him to go to find his security and did not return -- we are satisfied that Mr Walden acted in good faith and in full lenient discharge of his duty -- but trusted too much to the defendant's honesty to return -- If you can find it consistent with your duty, it would confer a favour on us, the friends of Mr Walden, by remitting the fine

John Barret Comths atty --
D Banks -- Mayor
C. W. Hutchin, County Judge
Adam Rankin Circuit Clerk.
Y, E, Allison County clk
J. S. Rouse D. S. of H. C.

Henderson Cir
vs
D N Walden
$40 --
RemittedSept /65
2nd Oct /65

Your Petitioner D. N. Walden would respectfully state that he acted in good faith & expected the party (Chars. Henessey) to come up promplty with his surity, but upon inquiry some 2 or 3 days after, found that he had left the state He would therefore ask Your Executive Clemency

Respectfully
D. N. Walden, Late Sheff Henderson Co
